page.title: 05Flora and Fauna-Biddestone
page.content: A lot of the farmland has been treated with sprays and wild flowers, insects and small mammals destroyed, but one farm at least is 'unimproved'. The small amount of woodland is mixed woodland, mainly indigenous trees, and rich in wildlife. There is downland with downland flora just south of Hartham Common and on the Bye Brook are kingfishers and dippers and marsh loving flowers. There is a biological records centre for the whole of Wiltshire in the museum in Devizes. This gives far more detail and is more accurate than this slight description can be.
